org.rootsdev.polygenea

Class Database

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.rootsdev.polygenea.Database
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<Node>, NodeLookup

    public class Database
extends java.lang.Object
implements NodeLookup, java.lang.Iterable<Node>
    The Database class represents a set of Node objects and provides indexed performance for UUID-based node lookups and incoming edge queries.

    Eventually, this class is intended to become a full disk-backed database; right now it primarily serves as a NodeLookup implementation.

    Author:
    Luther Tychonievich. Released into the public domain. I would consider it a courtesy if you cite my contributions to any code derived from this code or project that uses this code.

      • asSerializableCollection

        public java.util.List<Node> asSerializableCollection()
        All of the nodes in this database in an order such that all any node referenced by node X appears in the list before X itself appears. The result is guaranteed not to contain duplicates.
        Returns:
        A list of nodes in the database in an order that can be directly serialised.

        public java.util.Iterator<Node> iterator()

      • add

        public void add(Node... nodes)
        This method is more efficient than lookup, but it performs no error checking and may result in undefined behaviour if the provided nodes contains references to nodes that have not been added to this Database.
        Parameters:
        nodes - Node(s) to add to the database.

      • lookup

        public Node lookup(java.lang.Object o)
        Description copied from interface: NodeLookup
        Convert a JSON value into a Node object by looking it up in some pool of objects.

        The most common node encodings are UUID strings and integer list indices, but for future compatibility and to simplify interaction with Map<String, Object> representations of JSON the interface takes an arbitrary java.lang.Object.

        Specified by:
        lookup in interface NodeLookup
        Parameters:
        o - The JSON value to look up as a Node
        Returns:
        The Node found; or null if o was null.

      • out

        public java.util.Collection<Node> out(Node n)
        Returns a collection of the nodes that {code n} points to. Just wraps the Node class's out method right now.
        Parameters:
        n - The node in question
        Returns:
        A collection of nodes that n references.
